sentences.sContent: Her paintings have been exhibited all over the world.
sentences.sCn: 她的绘画作品在世界各地展出。

sentences.sContent: ...some children exhibit better self-control than others...
...a separate line of research by economists has shown that both boys and girls exhibit greater cognitive growth over the school year based on the "dose" of girls in a classroom...
...I heard the recent sculpture exhibit was kind of disappointing...
...And they continued to exhibit positive body-image attitudes as long as three years after completing the program...

trans.tranOther: to show something in a public place so that people can go to see it
something, for example a painting, that is put in a public place so that people can go to see it
